trans-unit.source: Securing your SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Securing your SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This article walks through the basics of securing the data tier of an application using Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: This article walks through the basics of securing the data tier of an application using Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: In particular, this articles will get you started with resources for limiting access, protecting data, and monitoring activities on a database created in the [Get started with SQL Database tutorial](sql-database-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: In particular, this articles will get you started with resources for limiting access, protecting data, and monitoring activities on a database created in the [Get started with SQL Database tutorial](sql-database-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: For a complete overview of security features available on all flavors of SQL, see the [Security Center for SQL Server Database Engine and Azure SQL Database](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb510589).
trans-unit.target: For a complete overview of security features available on all flavors of SQL, see the [Security Center for SQL Server Database Engine and Azure SQL Database](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb510589).

trans-unit.source: Connection Security
trans-unit.target: Connection Security

trans-unit.source: Connection Security refers to how you restrict and secure connections to your database using firewall rules and connection encryption.
trans-unit.target: Connection Security refers to how you restrict and secure connections to your database using firewall rules and connection encryption.

trans-unit.source: Firewall rules are used by both the server and the database to reject connection attempts from IP addresses that have not been explicitly whitelisted.
trans-unit.target: Firewall rules are used by both the server and the database to reject connection attempts from IP addresses that have not been explicitly whitelisted.

trans-unit.source: To allow your application or client machine's public IP address to attempt connecting to a new database, you must first create a server-level firewall rule using the Azure Management Portal, REST API, or PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: To allow your application or client machine's public IP address to attempt connecting to a new database, you must first create a server-level firewall rule using the Azure Management Portal, REST API, or PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, you should restrict the IP address ranges allowed through your server firewall as much as possible.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, you should restrict the IP address ranges allowed through your server firewall as much as possible.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure SQL Database Firewall](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee621782).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure SQL Database Firewall](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee621782).

trans-unit.source: All connections to Azure SQL Database require encryption (SSL/TLS) at all times while data is "in transit" to and from the database.
trans-unit.target: All connections to Azure SQL Database require encryption (SSL/TLS) at all times while data is "in transit" to and from the database.

trans-unit.source: In your application's connection string, you must specify parameters to encrypt the connection and *not* to trust the server certificate (this is done for you if you copy your connection string out of the Azure Management Portal), otherwise the connection will not verify the identity of the server and will be susceptible to "man-in-the-middle" attacks.
trans-unit.target: In your application's connection string, you must specify parameters to encrypt the connection and *not* to trust the server certificate (this is done for you if you copy your connection string out of the Azure Management Portal), otherwise the connection will not verify the identity of the server and will be susceptible to "man-in-the-middle" attacks.

trans-unit.source: For the ADO.NET driver, for instance, these connection string parameters are **Encrypt=True** and **TrustServerCertificate=False**.
trans-unit.target: For the ADO.NET driver, for instance, these connection string parameters are **Encrypt=True** and **TrustServerCertificate=False**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure SQL Database Connection Encryption and Certificate Validation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff394108#encryption).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure SQL Database Connection Encryption and Certificate Validation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff394108#encryption).

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: Authentication refers to how you prove your identity when connecting to the database.
trans-unit.target: Authentication refers to how you prove your identity when connecting to the database.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database currently supports SQL Authentication with a username and password.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database currently supports SQL Authentication with a username and password.

trans-unit.source: When you created the logical server for your database, you specified a "server admin" login with a username and password.
trans-unit.target: When you created the logical server for your database, you specified a "server admin" login with a username and password.

trans-unit.source: Using these credentials, you can authenticate to any database on that server as the database owner, or "dbo."
trans-unit.target: Using these credentials, you can authenticate to any database on that server as the database owner, or "dbo."

trans-unit.source: However, as a best practice your application should use a different account to authenticate -- this way you can limit the permissions granted to the application and reduce the risks of malicious activity in case your application code is vulnerable to a SQL injection attack.
trans-unit.target: However, as a best practice your application should use a different account to authenticate -- this way you can limit the permissions granted to the application and reduce the risks of malicious activity in case your application code is vulnerable to a SQL injection attack.

trans-unit.source: The recommended approach is to create a [contained database user](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff929188), which allows your app to authenticate directly to a single database with a username and password.
trans-unit.target: The recommended approach is to create a [contained database user](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff929188), which allows your app to authenticate directly to a single database with a username and password.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: Authorization refers to what you can do within an Azure SQL Database, and this is controlled by your user account's role memberships and permissions.
trans-unit.target: Authorization refers to what you can do within an Azure SQL Database, and this is controlled by your user account's role memberships and permissions.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, you should grant users the least privileges necessary.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, you should grant users the least privileges necessary.

trans-unit.source: The server admin account you are connecting with is a member of db_owner, which has authority to do anything within the database.
trans-unit.target: The server admin account you are connecting with is a member of db_owner, which has authority to do anything within the database.

trans-unit.source: Save this account for deploying schema upgrades and other management operations.
trans-unit.target: Save this account for deploying schema upgrades and other management operations.

trans-unit.source: Use the "ApplicationUser" account with more limited permissions to connect from your application to the database with the least privileges needed by your application.
trans-unit.target: Use the "ApplicationUser" account with more limited permissions to connect from your application to the database with the least privileges needed by your application.

trans-unit.source: [Database Roles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms189121) other than db_datareader and db_datawriter can be used to create more powerful application user accounts or less powerful management accounts.
trans-unit.target: [Database Roles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms189121) other than db_datareader and db_datawriter can be used to create more powerful application user accounts or less powerful management accounts.

trans-unit.source: Granular [Permissions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms191291) let you control which operations you can do on individual columns, tables, views, procedures, and other objects in the database.
trans-unit.target: Granular [Permissions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms191291) let you control which operations you can do on individual columns, tables, views, procedures, and other objects in the database.

trans-unit.source: [Impersonation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/vstudio/bb669087) and [module-signing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb669102) can be used to securely elevate permissions temporarily.
trans-unit.target: [Impersonation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/vstudio/bb669087) and [module-signing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb669102) can be used to securely elevate permissions temporarily.

trans-unit.source: [Row-Level Security](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn765131) lets you filter which rows a user can see.
trans-unit.target: [Row-Level Security](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn765131) lets you filter which rows a user can see.

trans-unit.source: [Data Masking](sql-database-dynamic-data-masking-get-started.md) can be used to limit exposure of sensitive data.
trans-unit.target: [Data Masking](sql-database-dynamic-data-masking-get-started.md) can be used to limit exposure of sensitive data.

trans-unit.source: [Stored procedures](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms190782) can be used to limit the actions that can be taken on the database.
trans-unit.target: [Stored procedures](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms190782) can be used to limit the actions that can be taken on the database.

trans-unit.source: Managing databases and logical servers from the Azure Management Portal or using the Azure Resource Manager API is controlled by your portal user account's role assignments.

trans-unit.source: Auditing
trans-unit.target: Auditing

trans-unit.source: Auditing and tracking database events can help you maintain regulatory compliance and identify suspicious activity.
trans-unit.target: Auditing and tracking database events can help you maintain regulatory compliance and identify suspicious activity.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database Auditing allows you to record events in your database to an audit log in your Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Auditing allows you to record events in your database to an audit log in your Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database Auditing also integrates with Microsoft Power BI to facilitate drill-down reports and analyses.
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Auditing also integrates with Microsoft Power BI to facilitate drill-down reports and analyses.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started with SQL Database Auditing](sql-database-auditing-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started with SQL Database Auditing](sql-database-auditing-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Compliance
trans-unit.target: Compliance

trans-unit.source: In addition to the above features and functionality that can help your application meet various security compliance requirements, Azure SQL Database also participates in regular audits and has been certified against a number of compliance standards.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the above features and functionality that can help your application meet various security compliance requirements, Azure SQL Database also participates in regular audits and has been certified against a number of compliance standards.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Microsoft Azure Trust Center](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/), where you can find the most current list of [SQL Database compliance certifications](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/services/).
